com.alexkasko.unsafe.offheaplong

Class OffHeapLongSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.alexkasko.unsafe.offheaplong.OffHeapLongSorter

  • public class OffHeapLongSorter
extends Object

    alexkasko: borrowed from https://android.googlesource.com/platform/libcore/+/android-4.2.2_r1/luni/src/main/java/java/util/DualPivotQuicksort.java and adapted to OffHeapLongAddressable.

    This class implements the Dual-Pivot Quicksort algorithm by Vladimir Yaroslavskiy, Jon Bentley, and Joshua Bloch. The algorithm offers O(n log(n)) performance on many data sets that cause other quicksorts to degrade to quadratic performance, and is typically faster than traditional (one-pivot) Quicksort implementations.

    Version:
    2009.11.29 m765.827.12i
    Author:
    Vladimir Yaroslavskiy, Jon Bentley, Josh Bloch

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int INSERTION_SORT_THRESHOLD
      If the length of an array to be sorted is less than this constant, insertion sort is used in preference to Quicksort.

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public static void sort(OffHeapLongAddressable a)
        Sorts the specified off-heap collection into ascending order.
        Parameters:
        a - the off-heap collection to be sorted

      • sort

        public static void sort(OffHeapLongAddressable a,
        long fromIndex,
        long toIndex)
        Sorts the specified range of the off-heap collection into ascending order. The range to be sorted extends from the index fromIndex, inclusive, to the index toIndex, exclusive. If fromIndex == toIndex, the range to be sorted is empty (and the call is a no-op).
        Parameters:
        a - the off-heap collection to be sorted
        fromIndex - the index of the first element, inclusive, to be sorted
        toIndex - the index of the last element, exclusive, to be sorted
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if (fromIndex < 0 || fromIndex > toIndex || toIndex > a.size())

      • sort

        public static void sort(OffHeapLongAddressable a,
        OffHeapLongComparator comp)
        Sorts the specified off-heap collection into ascending order.
        Parameters:
        a - the off-heap collection to be sorted
        comp - comparator that defines sort order

      • sort

        public static void sort(OffHeapLongAddressable a,
        long fromIndex,
        long toIndex,
        OffHeapLongComparator comp)
        Sorts the specified range of the off-heap collection into ascending order. The range to be sorted extends from the index fromIndex, inclusive, to the index toIndex, exclusive. If fromIndex == toIndex, the range to be sorted is empty (and the call is a no-op).
        Parameters:
        a - the off-heap collection to be sorted
        fromIndex - the index of the first element, inclusive, to be sorted
        toIndex - the index of the last element, exclusive, to be sorted
        comp - comparator that defines sort order
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if (fromIndex < 0 || fromIndex > toIndex || toIndex > a.size())

      • doSort

        private static void doSort(OffHeapLongAddressable a,
          long left,
          long right)
        Sorts the specified range of the off-heap collection into ascending order. This method differs from the public sort method in that the right index is inclusive, and it does no range checking on left or right.
        Parameters:
        a - the off-heap collection to be sorted
        left - the index of the first element, inclusive, to be sorted
        right - the index of the last element, inclusive, to be sorted

      • dualPivotQuicksort

                      long right)

        Parameters:
        a - the off-heap collection to be sorted
        left - the index of the first element, inclusive, to be sorted
        right - the index of the last element, inclusive, to be sorted

        left - the index of the first element, inclusive, to be sorted
